means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 瑟蒙职业名称，传教士或绰号，喋喋不休者来源于中世纪英语，含义是“布道”(sermon)

sentence.Network_en: At High Mass the priest preached a sermon on the devil.

sentence.Network_en: Sometimes the rector came up and preached a sermon.
sentence.Network_cn: 有时候教区牧师来布道.

sentence.Network_en: The minister preaches a sermon now and then.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (also in the sense 'speech, discourse'): from Old French, from Latin sermo(n-) 'discourse, talk'

entry.def: A sermon is a talk on a religious or moral subject that is given by a member of the clergy as part of a church service.

means.word_mean: 1. an address of a religious nature (usually delivered during a church service)
